Controller
Class JointRecorder

java.lang.Object
  Controller.JointRecorder

public class JointRecorder
extends java.lang.Object

JointRecorder records the position of joints and can be used to access the location of a joint at a specific point in time. Recording does not support multiple users, more that one user may interfere with recording.

Author:
Levi Lindsley

Field Summary

          Used only to print debug output

          The record of all joints at each distinct record call

Constructor Detail

JointRecorder

public JointRecorder()
Default Constructor

Method Detail

addJoint

public boolean addJoint(int j)
Adds a joint if it is not already in the set. Joints may not be added if there is recorded data, thus data may be added if isEmpty() is true.

Parameters:
j - : Integer to add to joints
Returns:
True if j added successfully. False if j already existed or record data exists

addAll

public boolean addAll()
Add what may be all the integers that SimpleOpenNI uses for skeletal joint positions. It seems to record all the points though some do always record as null. If record exists returns False and adds no points.

Returns:
True if at least one point was added to joints. False if a current record exist or no points were added.

record

public void record(SimpleOpenNI.SimpleOpenNI context,
                   int user)
Takes a snapshot of each focus joint and adds to record

Parameters:
context - : SimpleOpenNI instance to retrieve skeletal data from
user - : user id to retrieve skeleton from

getJoint

public processing.core.PVector getJoint(int time,
                                        int joint)
Retrieves the position of a joint at a given time

Parameters:
time - : the number of ticks from the beginning of the recording
joint - : the index of the joint to retrieve
Returns:
PVector representing joint at the given time, this is the same as calling GestureController.getRealcoordinites() at the time that the recording represents.

getTicks

public int getTicks()
Returns:
The size of the recorder, thus representing the number of ticks

contains

public boolean contains(int j)
Checks if joints contains j

Parameters:
j - : value to check for
Returns:
True if joints contains j. False in all other cases.

containsAll

public boolean containsAll(java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> j)
Check if j is a subset of joints

Parameters:
j - : Set to check for
Returns:
True if j is a subset of joints. False otherwise.

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Checks if there is any current recorded data, this will return true if there is no recorded data but there is focus joints.

Returns:
True if recorder is empty. False else.

clear

public void clear()
Clears the recorder, deleting the current recording, isEmpty() will return true after this is called until record() is called.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string of the recording and info about it, yea its toString() what where you expecting?

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
